definition: levitation (of Daoist immortal)/to become as light as a feather and ascend to heaven/(in Daoism) to become immortal/to die/of winged insects, to emerge from the cocoon in adult form/eclosion
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: The pupation and eclosion were hindered by treatment of larvae.
sentences.chinese: 處理的幼蟲化蛹率，羽化而受阻。

sentences.english: Finally, the adaptive significance of the emergence strategy was discussed.
sentences.chinese: 討論了這種羽化對策的適應意義。

sentences.english: Results The oligosaccharide could significantly increase the hatching rate and sexual vitality.
sentences.chinese: 結果巴戟天低聚糖能顯著提高果蠅性活力和羽化率。
蜂羽化後不久即可進行交尾。

sentences.english: In my case I want to use about 3 pixels of feather.
sentences.chinese: 在這裏，我使用了3個像素的羽化。

sentences.english: Both butterflies and their fuzzy, pre-cocoon form, the caterpillar, are pretty darn cute.
sentences.chinese: 無論是蝴蝶還是羽化前毛乎乎的毛毛蟲都相當可愛。

sentences.english: The oviposition rhythms and age-specific adult survival rates change.
sentences.chinese: 羽化雌蟲的產卵節律和成蟲生存曲線發生顯著變化。

sentences.english: Walking on this kind of path, I seem to ascend to heaven and become immortal.
sentences.chinese: 走在這樣的山路上，渾身其一種羽化的空靈。

definition: to levitate heavenwards (a Daoist success)/to take off/to soar (of prices)
mundane world (in religious context)/this mortal coil
to achieve the Dao/to become an immortal
to die in a seated posture (Buddhism)
to emerge from a pupa (of a butterfly etc)
magic transformation performed by Daoist immortal/fig. to reveal/to enlighten
to shed skin/to leave one's mortal envelope/remains (of a priest)
great emptiness/the void/heaven/the skies/universe/cosmos/original essence of the cosmos
